title: Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you're unwell during sick leaves | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you’re unwell during sick leaves

Date: October 2023 Source: Agence France-Presse

Companies in Germany are increasingly hiring detectives to investigate employees taking sick leave, amidst a backdrop of high absenteeism and a struggling economy. This troubling trend is highlighted by a rise in sick leave checks driven by concerns over productivity.

  • Significant scrutiny on sick leave practices in Germany.
  • Companies report a surge in requests for detective services to verify employee health.
  • A concerning trend of high sick leave rates impacting the economy, with 6.8% of working hours missed due to illness in 2023.
  • Economic contraction of 0.3 percent attributed to absenteeism.
“If someone has 30, 40 or sometimes up to 100 sick days in a year, then at some point they become economically unattractive for the employer.” - Marcus Lentz

The growing number of sick days has prompted fierce debates about work culture and employee wellness practices, especially against the backdrop of calls for longer work hours in other countries.
newTitle: Companies in Germany Hire Detectives to Verify Sick Leaves Amid Growing Scrutiny

title: Morning Bid: Hot US jobs data stoke yield fire, scold stocks - Reuters.com
On L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Call, Adar Poonawalla Says 'Even My Wife...' - News18
summary:
Adar Poonawalla Responds to L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Remark

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: News18

Adar Poonawalla, CEO of Serum Institute of India, has expressed his support for work-life balance in response to L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's call for longer workweeks.

  • Poonawalla noted on X (formerly Twitter) that even his wife enjoys their time together on Sundays.
  • This statement follows Subrahmanyan's controversial suggestion urging employees to work 90 hours a week and even forgo Sundays.
  • Responses to Subrahmanyan's remarks have come from various public figures emphasizing the importance of a balanced work-life approach.
“Even my wife loves staring at me on Sundays.” - Adar Poonawalla

The conversation surrounding work hours and life balance continues to spark significant discussion, indicating a broader societal concern for employee well-being.
newTitle: Adar Poonawalla Responds to L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Remark

title: Trading Plan: Will Nifty defend 23,350, Bank Nifty take support at 48,500? - Moneycontrol
summary:
Trading Plan: Will Nifty defend 23,350, Bank Nifty take support at 48,500?

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

The Nifty 50 is struggling around the 23,350 mark as it sees significant downward movement, with technical analysis suggesting potential support and resistance levels. Analysts examine potential targets and recovery points.

  • The Nifty 50 and Bank Nifty have experienced three consecutive days of decline.
  • If Nifty breaks 23,350, it may extend down to 23,263 or even 23,000.
  • A rebound above 23,600 could lead to movement towards 23,800-24,000.
  • Bank Nifty's critical support level is 48,500; breaking it could lead to a drop to 48,000.
  • Nifty closed at 23,432 on January 10, with a drop of 95 points and Bank Nifty at 48,734, down 769 points.

Rajesh Bhosale, Technical Analyst at Angel One: The decisive breakdown of the support trendline indicates potential further declines if key levels are breached.

In summary, both indices are navigating a challenging market environment, and traders should monitor key support and resistance levels closely to adjust their strategies accordingly.
newTitle: Nifty and Bank Nifty Trading Outlook for January 2025

title: Rupee to breach 86/$, RBI governor faces 1st major challenge - The Times of India
Air India to offer first class seats in A350-1000 planes to compete with best airlines | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Air India to Offer First Class Seats in A350-1000 Plans

Publication Date: New Delhi

Air India is set to include first class seats in its A350-1000 aircraft as part of its strategy to enhance its presence in the competitive airline market.

  • Air India's Chief Commercial Officer emphasized the importance of first class as a niche market.
  • The airline's fleet currently consists of 202 planes, with various routes identified for first class service.
  • Air India anticipates inducting A350-1000s in the coming years, with an initial focus on major markets like London and New York.
  • Efforts to retrofit existing aircraft, including Boeing 787s and legacy Airbus 320 neos, are underway.
  • The retrofit of Boeing 777 aircraft commences next year to improve service reliability.
"To compete with the best airlines you need to have first class, it is an aspirational product..." - Nipun Aggarwal, Chief Commercial Officer

The introduction of first class seating aims to enhance Air India's competitiveness and attract premium passengers, leveraging opportunities in strategic markets.
newTitle: Air India to Introduce First Class Seats in A350-1000 to Compete Globally

The State Bank of India (SBI) has faced a significant setback, losing Rs 44,935.46 crore in market valuation over just five days, coinciding with a decline in the Indian share market.

  • The market capitalisation of SBI has fallen to Rs 6,63,233.14 crore.
  • HDFC Bank reported a loss of Rs 70,479.23 crore in market cap during the same timeframe.
  • Overall, five of India's top-10 most-valued firms, including the largest firms, lost a combined Rs 1,85,952.31 crore in market valuation last week.

Despite the losses, Reliance Industries continues to be the most valuable firm in India.

summary:
Centre likely to save over Rs 70,000 crore on expenditure in FY25

Last Updated: Jan 12 2025 | Source: Not provided

The government may save over Rs 70,000 crore on capital and revenue expenditure allocated towards new schemes in the FY25 Budget that are yet to be implemented.

  • Three employment-linked incentive (ELI) schemes announced in the FY25 Budget with an allocation of Rs 10,000 crore.
  • The skill ministry is set to upgrade 1,000 ITIs with an outlay of Rs 1,000 crore, but these initiatives have not yet started.
  • The finance ministry allocated Rs 62,000 crore towards new schemes with the Department of Economic.

title: Windsor has created much-needed disruption in EV market: Parth Jindal - Business Standard
summary:
Windsor Disruption Boosts EV Sales, Says Parth Jindal

Publication Date: October 2024 | Source: Business Standard

Windsor, launched in September 2024, has successfully disrupted the electric vehicle (EV) market, according to Parth Jindal, Director of JSW MG Motor India.

The new model helped JSW MG Motor’s sales rise significantly while overall market growth was modest, showcasing its impact.

  • JSW MG Motor's sales grew 35% YoY to 20,580 units in Q4 2024.
  • Overall EV industry sales increased by only 5.4% YoY to 1.07 million units.
  • The MG Windsor aims to democratize electric mobility on Indian roads.
  • Electric car sales for JSW MG Motor doubled in 2024.
  • JSW’s market share in Indian electric car sales increased from 11.5% in 2023 to 21.66% in 2024.
  • Tata Motors’ market share declined from 72.68% to 62% over the same period.
“With several new launches planned, we are confident of surpassing previous benchmarks.” – Parth Jindal

This disruption in the EV market reflects a significant shift as consumers embrace more affordable and innovative electric vehicles.
newTitle: Windsor Disruption Boosts EV Sales, Says Parth Jindal

title: Air India plans more premium seats, eyes higher connecting traffic to tap 'huge growth opportunities' - Moneycontrol
summary:
Air India plans more premium seats, eyes higher connecting traffic to tap 'huge growth opportunities'

Date: January 12, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Air India is strategically increasing its premium economy and business class seating to tap into significant growth opportunities. Since the Tata Group took over in 2022, the airline's revenue has surged almost tenfold.

  • Air India will add more premium economy and business class seats to its fleet.
  • Realignment of flight timings is set to enhance connecting traffic.
  • Daily flights stand at 1,168, with 313 international destinations.
  • Revenue growth for premium segments has increased 2.3X, compared to 1.3X for economy.
“We are very focused on the premium segment and there are huge opportunities,” said Nipun Aggarwal, Chief Commercial Officer.

In conclusion, Air India's expansion into the premium seating market reflects a robust strategy to leverage existing growth opportunities and enhance its service offerings further.
newTitle: Air India Expands Premium Offerings to Capture Growth Market

title: Microsoft rules out layoffs in India amid global job cuts - BusinessLine
summary:
Microsoft Rules Out Layoffs in India Amid Global Job Cuts

Publication Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Businessline

Microsoft has confirmed that it will not proceed with layoffs in its India operations, despite global job cuts affecting a small percentage of its workforce. Puneet Chandok emphasized job creation in India and ongoing projects that require personnel.

  • Microsoft has around 20,000 employees in India, while the total global workforce is 228,000.
  • The number of job cuts globally is less than 1% and is based on performance evaluations.
  • Recent layoffs are minimal compared to earlier massive cuts, such as 10,000 in early 2023 and 1,900 in the gaming segment in January 2024.
  • Satya Nadella's visit to India coincided with the job cut news, during which he announced a $3 billion investment for cloud and AI infrastructure over two years.
  • Nadella remarked that India is becoming a leader in AI innovation, calling for collaborative efforts to enhance productivity.
“We will continue to use AI to unlock possibilities for the next few decades and ensure that communities across the country have access to the compute they need to prosper in the AI era.” - Puneet Chandok

This announcement reinforces Microsoft's commitment to India as a key player in its future AI strategy, seeking to expand its workforce and foster innovation in the region.
newTitle: Microsoft Rules Out Layoffs in India Amid Global Job Cuts

title: Elon Musk's Grok diagnoses fracture missed by doctors, US woman claims in viral post - India Today
summary:
Elon Musk's Grok diagnoses fracture missed by doctors, US woman claims in viral post

Published On: Jan 12, 2025 | Published By: Akshita Singh

A US-based woman claimed that Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, correctly identified her daughter's fracture -- something medical professionals reportedly missed. The revelation, shared in a post on X, has sparked debate over AI's potential role in healthcare.

  • AJ Kay reported her daughter was in a serious car accident, appearing unscathed initially.
  • Doctors, after examination and X-rays, diagnosed no fracture and sent her home with painkillers.
  • Concerned by worsening symptoms, Kay turned to Grok for a second opinion, uploading the X-ray images.
  • Grok identified a clear fracture line in the distal radius.
  • A wrist specialist confirmed the diagnosis and warned of potential surgery if treatment was delayed.
  • The incident has ignited discussions about AI's role in healthcare, with mixed reactions from the public.
“There's a clear fracture line in the distal radius.” - Grok

This incident highlights the potential benefits and concerns surrounding the integration of AI in medical diagnosis, proving to be both a cautionary tale and a groundbreaking moment for AI in healthcare.
newTitle: Elon Musk's Grok Diagnoses Missed Fracture in U.S. Woman's Daughter

"The Kia EV6 already comes with 350 kW DC fast charging capabilities to charge the battery from 10 to 80 percent in just 18 minutes."

The Kia SUV's arrival signifies a noteworthy advancement in the electric vehicle market in India, set to create substantial competition among EV offerings.

Date: Updated Jan 12, 2025

Source: ET NOW News

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is set to considerably expand its presence in Bengaluru by acquiring land for Rs 1,625 crore, aimed at increasing its capacity by over 25,000 seats in a key IT area.

  • TCS aims to enhance profit margins as the BSNL deal winds down in the coming quarters.
  • The recent land acquisition reflects TCS's commitment to growth in the IT sector.

title: Maruti Suzuki To Launch 2 New Midsize SUVs This Year - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
Maruti Suzuki To Launch 2 New Midsize SUVs This Year

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Gaadiwaadi

Maruti Suzuki is set to launch two new midsize SUVs in India this year, aiming to capture a larger share of the rapidly growing midsize segment. The company will offer diverse powertrains for these models.

  • The e Vitara, a pure electric model, will debut at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025.
  • It features a masculine design and modern SUV characteristics, including a high driving position and a digital instrument cluster.
  • The e Vitara will offer multiple variants with different battery capacities and a range of approximately 550 km.
  • The second model, internally named 'Maruti Y17', will be a larger version of the Grand Vitara, featuring an additional row of seats.
  • The Y17 is expected to have both mild-hybrid and full-hybrid options.
The full-hybrid system combines a 68 kW (91 hp) petrol engine with an electric motor, providing a total of 114 hp.

This move aims to strengthen Maruti Suzuki's position in the competitive midsize SUV market in India.

title: 'Kaam kab karega?': Indian boss rejected candidate because he played guitar, ran marathons - Hindustan Times
summary:
'Kaam kab karega?': Indian boss rejected candidate because he played guitar, ran marathons

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The COO of UK magazine Tatler Asia shared a story about an Indian boss who denied a candidate a job simply for mentioning his hobbies in the CV, highlighting ongoing discussions on work-life balance.

  • A candidate was rejected for highlighting his interest in marathons and playing guitar.
  • This incident was shared on social media by Parminder Singh, the COO of Tatler Asia.
  • Singh expressed regret for not hiring the capable candidate, comparing it to more progressive hiring practices at Google.
  • The discussion around this rejection also ties back to controversial comments made by L&T chairman advocating for long work hours.
“My boss didn’t let me hire him, saying, 'Yeh aadmi yeh sab kuchh karta hai to kaam kab karega?'” - Parminder Singh

This incident reflects a prevailing mindset in some corporate cultures that undervalues well-rounded candidates, and raises questions about the future of work-life balance in India.
newTitle: 'Kaam kab karega?': Indian boss rejected candidate because he played guitar, ran marathons

title: TCS expects margin benefits as BSNL deal tapers; to create 25K-seat capacity in Bengaluru: CFO | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
TCS Anticipates Margin Growth Amid BSNL Deal Tapering and Plans for 25K New Seats in Bengaluru

Date: January 12, 2023 | Source: PTI

TCS's CFO, Samir Seksaria, highlights expected margin benefits as the BSNL deal tapers off, along with plans to expand operational capacity in Bengaluru.

  • Tapering of the BSNL deal expected to positively affect TCS margins.
  • Company plans to create a capacity of over 25,000 seats in Bengaluru.
  • Current operating profit margin stands at 24.5% for the December quarter.
  • TCS will compensate for the tapering BSNL revenue through other sources.
  • Plans to enter the aspirational profit margin band of 26-28% by FY26.
  • Company manages financial impacts of currency fluctuations via an active hedging program.
“The same program (BSNL) as it tapers down at a portfolio level, at an overall level, there would be a benefit which would come in (on margins)” - Samir Seksaria, CFO

The expansion plans and efficiencies expected from the tapering BSNL deal signal optimistic growth for TCS and its commitment to enhancing operational capacities in a competitive IT market.
newTitle: TCS Anticipates Margin Growth Amid BSNL Deal Tapering and Plans for 25K New Seats in Bengaluru

title: Woman Claims Elon Musk's Grok Detected Her Daughter's Fracture After Doctors Fail To Diagnose It - NDTV
summary:
AI Chatbot Grok Identifies Fracture After Misdiagnosis by Doctors

Publication Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Twitter (X)

A mother claims that Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, successfully diagnosed her daughter's fracture after medical professionals failed to do so following a car accident. This incident raises questions about AI's role in healthcare.

  • AJ Kay's daughter was in a car accident and initially evaluated by medical professionals.
  • Despite being told there were no fractures, the daughter's symptoms worsened, prompting further investigation.
  • Using Grok, the AI identified a fracture that was missed in earlier assessments.
  • A wrist specialist later confirmed Grok's diagnosis, emphasizing the importance of timely treatment.
  • The case has sparked discussions about the reliability of AI in diagnosing medical issues.
“True story: @Grok diagnosed my daughter's broken wrist last week.” — AJ Kay

This case highlights the potential of AI in providing second opinions in medical diagnostics, though it also poses questions about reliance on technology versus human expertise.
newTitle: AI Chatbot Grok Identifies Fracture After Misdiagnosis by Doctors
